content: On November 5, 1990, the Atlanta Braves made a significant trade that would shape the future of the franchise. They acquired pitcher Greg Maddux from the Chicago Cubs, who would go on to become one of the greatest pitchers in baseball history. Maddux's tenure with the Braves brought four consecutive Cy Young Awards and helped lead the team to a World Series championship in 1995, solidifying his legacy in Atlanta and the sport.
